e4: Maintaining the current policy perpetuates a dishonest practice, even if it's predictable.  Switching to the new policy promotes ethical reporting. Although there will be a temporary negative market reaction, the long-term benefits of increased trust and transparency outweigh this short-term risk.  It is crucial to clearly communicate the policy change to investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness.  It should present a complete and unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, avoiding any intentional manipulation or misleading practices.  It should also consider the potential impact on all stakeholders, including investors of varying sophistication, and strive to avoid creating unfair advantages.
e6: I would ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, including strategies to mitigate the anticipated negative market reaction. I'd also want to understand the rationale behind the previous management's decision to implement the biased reporting policy in the first place.
